item.title: awsenv
item.description: To quickly log into and switch between AWS accounts in a terminal, I wrote the following script. It sets the AWS_PROFILE environment variable which is used by many tools that interact with the AWS API, like awscli or terraform. My current environment uses AzureAD as a single-sign-on provider, therefore this script uses aws sso login to perform an MFA login into AWS. The AWS profiles must be set up in such a way that aws configure list-profiles can detect them, which is typically done by adding them in ${AWS_CONFIG_FILE:-$HOME/.
